text: <@U08F2NL9K|zincsamael> has joined the channel
<http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2015/08/low-overhead-rendering-with-vulkan.html?linkId=16183143>
Wut
I thought that was dead
That is insanely awesome
<@U061HDV96>: who told you Vulkan was dead?
<@U053LEHJN>: no one. I just never really heard of it since it was announced or something a while back.
It's essentially a standardized Mantle API, which kicked off the whole low-overhead race to begin with
Might just paste this here: <http://blog.imgtec.com/powervr/gnomes-per-second-in-vulkan-and-opengl-es>

attachments.title: Gnomes per second in Vulkan and OpenGL ES - Imagination Blog
attachments.text: Imagination are excited to show you a new Vulkan demo designed to highlight the specific benefits we believe Vulkan should bring developers and devices.
attachments.fallback: Imagination Blog: Gnomes per second in Vulkan and OpenGL ES - Imagination Blog

text: (which is why I get upset when all people will talk about is DirectX 12)
I know DirectX is for Windows, but what's good/special about Mantle?
Never really looked it up and such.
Well for one thing, Vulkan is cross-platform
I don't even pay attention to DirectX since choosing to use it would immediately limit me to Windows machines
Looking at only performance
What is the difference between Vulkan and DirectX then?
I don't know, Vulkan isn't out yet
but they both have a goal of reducing driver overhead
as well as enabling sending commands to the GPU in parallel across your cpu threads
I was hoping for that
Multi GPU too on Vulkan
yes
like I said, Mantle began all of these concepts
Do you think this will be a huge step forward in gaming performance?
uh, yeah
also, since Vulkan is a much lower-level API, I doubt there'll be as many driver issues
plus shaders are represented as SPIR-V instead of GLSL, so driver vendors don't need to deal with the GLSL compile step anymore
Explain?
(not to mention, since it's now using an intermediary format, there's nothing stopping you from compiling any other language to SPIR-V and running it on the GPU)
<https://www.khronos.org/spir>
haven't worked in DirectX in forever, but when I did, OpenGL had way less overhead
I'll be  interested to see what Apple does with Metal
SPIR looks cool
since they're on the Khronos board
Metal* not Mantle
not sure if apple takes gaming that seriously
<@U04U5KS3Z>: you must've missed their last few keynotes then
So OSX will suffer even more?
oh they make a song and dance at the keynotes for sure
I'd say they are, since gamers is the only audience they aren't attracting much
<@U061HDV96>: well, since Apple wants complete control over their systems, it means they are left to write graphics drivers themselves
I was talking specifically about iOS, btw
not OSX
Will Vulkan work on OSX?
Or iOS
<@U061HDV96>: that's up to Apple, hence my curiosity
I hope so
they just invested all of this development and marketing into Metal
which, again, is just another proprietary variant of Mantle
neither Apple nor Microsoft had to wait for a committee to ship their respective APIs, though
Marketing?
Since when do they market Metal?
<@U061HDV96>: I consider devoting a significant chunk of keynotes to talking about Metal marketing, yes
then again that’s been happening for a while
doom 3 (or quake) debuted on macwork
macworld
Ugh
or something
Here we are once again
that Gnomes per second video is wow
At a road that splits
*sigh*
What about OpenGL then?
<@U061HDV96>: again, Apple sits on the Khronos board; I'd be surprised if they didn't adopt Vulkan
and OpenGL will still exist as it is
it's a higher-level API
You didn't say they were on the board
What are the advantages of OpenGL then? More easy like a high level programming level compared to low level?
i hope vulkan gains traction
hopefully more multi platform games
<@U061HDV96>: direct your attention to the giant logos here: <https://www.khronos.org/members/promoters>
and the advantage of OpenGL is: it's been used for over 20 years and isn't going away anytime soon
I'd wager Vulkan will come with Android M MR1
i would have thought Valve was on that list but maybe they just cheerleading vulkan right now
<@U04U5KS3Z>: Valve is on the other list: <https://www.khronos.org/members/contributors>
MS is on there?
Valve, Microsoft, and Google are all members
with voting rights
ah makes snese
sense
EEE
:wink:
<@U08SZ817D|jackmalpo> has joined the channel
<@U053LEHJN>: any idea when the first game with vulkan is gonna come?
or first engine
I see unity on the list and other dev teams
<@U061HDV96>: well the spec isn't out yet
but Unity, Unreal, et al are members so they get to see it before it's released
so I'd expect they'll ship updates for their engines either when the spec is released or soon after
Valve says Source 2.0 is already on Vulkan
wow that's quick
well like I said, it's basically Mantle
so it wasn't that difficult to get something up and running
OH ya
It was Mantle that I thought was dead
I don't really follow this stuf
But am starting to follow it now
I'm just excited to see more things in the games
People have to worry less about performance
(For small games)
AMD gave Khronos the Mantle spec and told them to use it as the basis for Vulkan, no strings attached
AMD is such a great company
AMD only created Mantle in the first place to kick Microsoft and Khronos in gear
"You call those graphics APIs? THIS is a graphics API."
I wish AMD could get something in return for all they've done
well, Intel has officially stagnated
so AMD is due to catch them off guard here soon
that's how it happened with AMD64, anyway
Ya, skipping a tick-tock cycle :confused:
The Fury X is getting there
well not just that, newer Intels just aren't worth it
I know
My i7-2600 is still doing great
most people are still using first-gen Core i7s without feeling the need to upgrade
There is no real performance gain
Well no big ones
I'm hoping Zen is AMD's real trump card
I thought it was going to be Fury with HBM
but Nvidia will have HBM 2.0 for Pascal
Really?
Damnit
yes, of course AMD will as well
I know
Weren't they first in line to get them from the manufacturers?
6 months before Nvidia or something?
I do really hope AMD kicks Nvidia's ass
AMD debuted HBM 1.0
Yes I know, wasn't that why they were first in line?
For 2.0
I don't think there's a line for 2.0
SK Hynix would probably sell to both equally
I thought they would sell only to AMD
because they developer the tech
And later to Nvidia
I hope that immediately going to 14nm for Zen is gonna be worth it
nope, both Arctic Islands and Pascal are slated to get HBM 2.0
:disappointed:
AMD is gonna have a very hard time
I hope FreeSync gets some more attention from normal users
Arctic Islands will be 14nm as well
which is why I've decided to skip buying a GPU this gen

I upgrade every 2 gens I think

though it doesn't get any of the new fancy Nvidia features that came with Kepler
I don't use any of those features
